section.p: You take the ship north until you are passing the Peaks at the Edge of the World to the west - awesome mountains that rise majestically into the clouds. To the north, you find that the sea comes up against huge cliffs, towering into the heavens. A strong current threatens to pull your ship into a gigantic cave at the base of the cliffs. The sea churns violently at the cave mouth, throwing up great waves.

On either side of the cave mouth, two enormous statues stand waist-deep in the sea. They are stone warriors of cyclopean size, weather-beaten and pitted - they have been standing there for hundreds of years, perhaps even thousands. Their faces look out across the world, as if observing distant events far off to the south.
‘The Silent Sentinels,’ whispers one of the crew in awed tones.
‘Aye,’ says another, ‘the Guardians at the World’s Edge. Best to turn back now, captain.’
‘Some say that’s the Mouth of Harkun, the elder god from whose bones the world was formed, and that it leads to the land below the world! Turn back, cap’n, please!’ says your first mate.

choices.choice: Entreat the men to enter the cave
